title: Former Lord Of The Rings worker jailed for murdering parents in row over dog
text:
Sergey Koudryavtsev has been jailed for stabbing parents to death in row over dog (Picture: PA; Getty)

A visual effects technician who worked on Lord Of The Rings has been jailed for at least 26 years for stabbing his parents to death.

Sergey Koudryavtsev, 48, killed his mother Tatiana and father Vladimir at their home earlier this year following a row over his dog Enzo.

Koudryavtsev returned to live with his parents at their home in West Kensington, London, following the break-up of his marriage.

He moved in with his pet Mastiff, who the court heard he was ‘obsessed’ with.

His pet Enzo was ageing and suffering from health problems and Koudryavtsev believed his parents did not treat the dog as their equal.

The court heard that the family would leave the window open which Koudryavtsev believed made his dog’s health conditions worse.

In his ‘rage and frustration’ he stabbed his parents before going to the police three days later to ‘surrender himself for murder.’

During a hearing at London’s Old Bailey, Koudryavtsev entered guilty pleas to the murders.

Judge Nicholas Hilliard QC sentenced him to life in jail with a minimum term of 26 years.

Sergey Koudryavtsev was ‘obsessed’ with his dog Enzo and flew into a rage (Picture: PA)

The court heard Koudryavtsev was born in Rostov, Russia, and carved out a successful career in movies after completing a maths degree.

His credits included Blade, Resident Evil, Avatar, District 9 and Rise Of The Planet Of The Apes.

Prosecutor Anthony Orchard QC told the court that Koudryavtsev called police on May 23 this year.

Officers arrived at the home in Adair Tower and found his mother dead in the bath fully clothed and his father’s body in the bedroom.

Mr Orchard said Mrs Koudriavtseva had degrees in chemistry and history of art and had been a university lecturer.

Mr Koudriavtsev had a PhD in physics and maths and had been given just weeks to live having suffered from cancer and strokes.

Their son was described as ‘exceptionally clever’ but lacking in social skills.

He had emigrated to New Zealand in 2002 and worked on visual effects for the Lord of the Rings films before moving back to East Horsley, Surrey with his wife.

While living in New Zealand, Koudriavtsev got two dogs called Boris and Nikita and when Boris became ill and had to be put down, he got a Mastiff puppy Enzo.

When Nikita died, the defendant became ‘scary’ to live with and blamed his wife for the death of his pet, the court heard.

Following the marriage collapse, Koudriavtsev moved in with his parents in London but he became abusive.

His mother told her friend: ‘I’m scared to go home. I’m terrified what he can do.’

After his arrest in Chiddingford, Surrey, police seized two blades from the flat, a hunting and combat knife.

In a police interview, Koudryavtsev, said he loved Enzo more than his wife and was enraged that his parents did not appreciate that dogs were ‘equal to humans.’

He said that he had ‘fantastised’ about killing his parents for up to four months before the brutal attack.

Afterwards, he said he panicked about Enzo’s future and set about finding him a good home, which he refused to reveal to police.

Judge Hilliard said Koudryavtsev’s parents’ lives ‘must have been very difficult indeed’ in their final weeks.

The judge said: ‘A friend said the two of them were very much in love and very proud of you and your achievements.’

The defendant made no reaction as he was led from the dock.
